contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=February 2008}} '''Premyer-Ministr''' ({{lang-ru|Премьер-Министр}}, lit. ''prime minister'') is a [[Russia]]n musical group. The idea behind the band was to form a [[boy band]], though not especially for teenagers. Four men came together to form Premier Ministr in 1997. Their first real success came in 2000 with the remake of a very popular Russian tune, "Oriental Song". It became a huge hit in Russia. In 2001 one of the members, Dmitry Lansky, left the group for a solo career and was replaced. Premyer-Ministr was comprised Jean Grigoriev-Milimerov ([[Moscow]], December 5, 1979), Peter Jason (Moscow, September 9, 1979), Vyacheslav Bodolika (Ungeny, [[Moldavia]], June 18, 1977) and Marat Chanyshev (Moscow, March 25, 1975). In 2002, Russian television invited the group to participate in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2002|Eurovision Song Contest]] in [[Tallinn]]. They translated their name into "Prime Minister", and sung "[[Northern Girl]]", which reached the top-10. There were two videos made for "Northern Girl", the English and Russian versions, called "Девочка С Севера" (Girl From The North). In 2005, the group members split with their producer and started independent career as Group PM, while Premier Ministr was started anew with Taras Demchuk, Sergey Demyanchuk, [[Amarkhuu Borkhuu]], and Vasily Kireyev. ==External links== *[http://www.premier-ministr.ru Official website] {{ru icon}} {{Start box}} {{succession box |before=[[Mumiy Troll]]<br>with ''"[[Lady Alpine Blue]]"'' |title=[[Russia in the Eurovision Song Contest]] |years=2002 |after=[[t.A.T.u.]]<br>with ''"[[Ne Ver', Ne Boysia]]"'' }} {{end box}} [[Category:Russian boy bands]] [[Category:Russian Eurovision Song Contest entrants]] [[Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants of 2002]] [[Category:Russian pop music groups]]
